poem:
Title: "On Resilience"

The winds of change howl,
In ironclad vows and stern warnings.
In the hewn halls of power,
Echo the cries of ancient suffering.
An unquiet surge, antisemitism roars,
Chasing peace from the sacred olive groves.
Yet from Zion's rooted heart,
Borne on the wings of history's pain,
Rises the indomitable spirit,
Affirming existence, even in the face of rain.
